aardvark.fact: The name aardvark means earth pig

bass.fact: Bass swim at 2.5 times their body length per second

bear.fact: Bears can walk a short distance on their hind legs

boar.fact: Boars use their long snouts to dig underground roots

buffalo.fact: Buffalo are known to kill lions

calf.fact: Newborn calves can see, stand and walk

carp.fact: carp can live up to 20 years

catfish.fact: Catfish can be found in all continents except Antarctica

cheetah.fact: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals on Earth

chicken.fact: Chickens can distinguish between more than 100 faces

chub.fact: Often referred to as a minnow

clam.fact: There are over 15,000 species of clam in the world

crab.fact: Crabs can walk in all directions

crayfish.fact: Crawfish can be blue, green, white, or yellow before they are cooked

crow.fact: Crows can solve puzzles that human children can solve

deer.fact: Male deer are called bucks while female deer are called does

dogfish.fact: dogfish can live more than 80 years

dolphin.fact: Dolphins can reach speeds of over 30 mph for brief periods

dove.fact: Doves have feathers that are loosely attached to their bodies

duck.fact: Ducklings communicate with eachother before hatching

elephant.fact: Elephants are the world's larget land animal

flamingo.fact: Flamingo nests are made of mud

flea.fact: Fleas can jump around 30 thousand times in a row

fruitbat.fact: Bats eat thousands of mosquitoes at night

giraffe.fact: Giraffes are the tallest mammals on Earth

gnat.fact: Gnats can lay up to 300 eggs in a single day

goat.fact: Goats were one of the first animals to be tamed by humans

gull.fact: Gulls can live for 10-15 years in the wild

haddock.fact: Haddock can reach one to three feet in length

hare.fact: Hares are larger than rabbits and have longer ears

herring.fact: The herring is an extremely thin fish

honeybee.fact: Honney Bees typically make about 1/12 a teaspoon of honey in its life time

housefly.fact: Houseflies can see around them in a nearly 360-degree field of view

kiwi.fact: Kiwis moult their feathers throughout the year

ladybug.fact: A ladybug can eat up to 5,000 insects in its lifetime

lark.fact: Larks are found mainly in Australia

leopard.fact: Leopards are extremely difficult to trace and locate in the wild

lion.fact: Lions are the only cats to live in groups

lobster.fact: Lobsters were once considered the poor man's chicken

lynx.fact: The lynx is more than twice the size of a house cat

mink.fact: minks communicate using odors, visual signals, and other sounds

mole.fact: Moles can dig up to 18 feet in one hour

moth.fact: Moths have an extremely strong sense of smell

newt.fact: Newts have the ability to regenerate limbs

opossum.fact: Opossums can play dead for up to four hours

oryx.fact: Oryxes  have a lifespan of about 20 years

ostrich.fact: Ostriches have the largest eyes of any land mammal

parakeet.fact: Some parakeets are able to mimic some of your words

pheasant.fact: Pheasants do not migrate like other birds

piranha.fact: Piranhas in South America are usually kept as pets

pitviper.fact: Pit vipers are able to sense body heat from animals

polecat.fact: Polecats have very thick and silky brown fur

pony.fact: Ponies have thicker manes and tails than horses

puma.fact: Pumas are very good climbers and also know how to swim

raccoon.fact: Raccoons have been around for 40,000 years

reindeer.fact: Both male and femal reindeer grow antlers

rhea.fact: Rheas have very long wings despite being flightless birds

seahorse.fact: Seahorses prefer to swim in pairs with their tails linked together

seal.fact: Seals can live up to 35 years in the wild

sealion.fact: Sea lions are extremely skilled hunters

seasnake.fact: There are 69 species of sea snakes

seawasp.fact: Sea wasp venom can kill people in as few as three minutes

skimmer.fact: Skimmers are the only birds with distinctive uneven bills

skua.fact: Skuas are extremely aggressive in protecting their nesting sites

slowworm.fact: slow worms can eat up to 20 slugs in 20 minutes

slug.fact: slugs have both female and male organs and can fertilize their own eggs

sole.fact: As larva, Soles have eyes on either side of their bodies

sparrow.fact: Sparrow live close to humans because of the constant supply of food

squirrel.fact: Squirrels can find food buried beneath a foot of snow

starfish.fact: Starfish have no brain and no blood

swan.fact: Swans can have winspans up to 10 feet

toad.fact: Toads have dry warty skin and shorter legs than frogs

tortoise.fact: Tortoises can live to over 100 years old

tuatara.fact: Although how similar it looks to a lizard, tuataras are not lizards

tuna.fact: Tuna can live for 35 years, sometimes even longer

vole.fact: Voles are typically referred to as field mice

vulture.fact: Vultures can glide for hours at a time looking for their next meals

wallaby.fact: A wallaby's tail is about the same length as its body

wasp.fact: Wasps can be found everywhere except Antarctica

wolf.fact: Wolves are the largest members of the dog family

worm.fact: A worm has no arms, legs or eyes

wren.fact: The wren is easily recognized by its upward pointing tail and darting flight
